title: GTA Garage Deals Web Application
description: The GTA Garage Deals is a web application developed as a group project during our Final Sem in the Software Engineering program at Centennial College. This project was completed as part of our coursework in Web Application Development and is hosted on GitHub.

This application provides users with a streamlined platform to discover and participate in garage sales across the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). The design is user-friendly, making it easy for both buyers and sellers to navigate and interact with the application.

title: The Magic Chef Web Application
description: The Magic Chef is a web application we developed as a group Project during our Third Sem in my Software Engineering Technician program at Centennial College. The project was completed in my Web Application Development course and is hosted on GitHub.

This application provides users with the facility to create recipes and leave reviews on them. It is very friendly in terms of design and function, which makes working with this application quite easy for users.

title: On-the-Job Training Monitoring System
description: The OJT Monitoring System was developed as a group project in my Bachelor of Information Technology program at Samar College in the Philippines. This Project is a Web and Android-based application, and it's part of our course requirement to develop a software application that will be defended before finishing the program. We decided to create this project that would manage on-the-job training experiences for students, in which I was mainly designated in the design and documentation.

The application provides a systematic way of recording student training progress, communication between students and supervisors, and ultimately, awareness regarding the entire impact of training programs conducted. It consists of a user-friendly interface which will create better usability for both students and administrators.
